body:
@tgamblin @alalazo 
See #2245 

My concern here is that different config file systems, authored by different Spackers, use different conventions.  `config.yaml` uses lower-case names with dollar signs, possibly surrounded by curly braces.  Module configuration uses upper-case names with dollar signs.  There is talk about maybe just using curly braces, not dollar signs.

Whatever we decide... we should make sure that decision is implemented consistently across *all* Spack configuration files.
title: Consistency of Config Files
